nb.purpose: For √• st√∏tte registreringen av en oversikt eller oppsummering av en bekreftet graviditet og utfall, inkludert svangerskapsperioden, f√∏dselen og den umiddelbare postpartum perioden.
nb.use:
*Use to record an overview or summary record of an identified pregnancy and outcome, including the antenatal period, labor, birth and the immediate postnatal period. 

During an active pregnancy, this archetype supports the evolution of a persistent pregnancy-related health summary record, with information gradually accumulated or updated, throughout the duration of the pregnancy, labour, birth and the immediate postnatal period. As the data is committed to the persistent health record, the date of the update is also recorded in the 'Last Updated' data element in Protocol, to ensure that if this pregnancy summary is taken out of context of the health record for other purposes, such as data exchange, the date of the latest update is kept with the clinical data.

After birth, this summary record can be used to share essential information with other healthcare providers about the pregnancy, labour, birth and immediate postnatal period. 

Each completed pregnancy summary saved to the health record can be re-used to populate the Past Pregnancy History details in subsequent pregnancy records.

In situations where completed pregnancy summaries are not available for each previous pregnancy, this archetype can also be used to record a relevant subset of information that can be used to populate the Past Pregnancy History details with new or active pregnancy records. (en)
nb.misuse:
Brukes ikke for √• dokumentere event-based informasjon i l√∏pet av graviditeten, f√∏dsel og den umiddelbare postpartum perioden. Disse vil bli dokumentert ved bruk av OBSERVATION arketyper, for eksempel informasjon som er relatert til historikk og unders√∏kelser ved svangerskapskontroller og under f√∏dselen.

Brukes ikke for √• dokumentere sammenfattet informasjon om kvinnens obstetriske historie - bruk EVALUATION.obstetric_summary.

Brukes ikke for √• dokumentere detaljert informasjon om kvinnens menstruasjonssyklus - bruk OBSERVATION.menstrual_cycle.

Brukes ikke for √• dokumentere detaljert informasjon om spedbarns m√•ltider/mating - en seperat arketype vil bli brukt til dette form√•let.

Brukes ikke for √• dokumentere en generell sammenfattet menstruasjonshistorikk eller menstruasjonsdagbok - seperate arketyper vil bli brukt til dette form√•let.

en.purpose: To support the recording of an overview or summary record of an identified pregnancy and outcome, including the antenatal period, labor, birth and the immediate postnatal period.
en.use:
Use to record an overview or summary record of an identified pregnancy and outcome, including the antenatal period, labor, birth and the immediate postnatal period. 

During an active pregnancy, this archetype supports the evolution of a persistent pregnancy-related health summary record, with information gradually accumulated or updated, throughout the duration of the pregnancy, labour, birth and the immediate postnatal period. As the data is committed to the persistent health record, the date of the update is also recorded in the 'Last Updated' data element in Protocol, to ensure that if this pregnancy summary is taken out of context of the health record for other purposes, such as data exchange, the date of the latest update is kept with the clinical data.

After birth, this summary record can be used to share essential information with other healthcare providers about the pregnancy, labour, birth and immediate postnatal period. 

Each completed pregnancy summary saved to the health record can be re-used to populate the Past Pregnancy History details in subsequent pregnancy records.

In situations where completed pregnancy summaries are not available for each previous pregnancy, this archetype can also be used to record a relevant subset of information that can be used to populate the Past Pregnancy History details with new or active pregnancy records.
en.misuse:
Not to be used to record event-based information during the pregnancy, labor, birth and immediate postnatal period. These will be recorded using OBSERVATION archetypes - for example, the information related to history & examination during antenatal visits or during labour.

Not to be used to record summary information about a woman's Obstetric history - use EVALUATION.obstetric_summary.

Not to be used to record detailed information about a woman's Menstrual Cycle - use OBSERVATION.menstrual_cycle.

Not to be used to record detailed information about infant feeding - a separate archetype will be used.

Not to be used to record a general menstrual history summary or diary - separate archetypes will be used.

es-co.misuse:
No debe utilizarse para registrar informaci√≥n de eventos durante el embarazo, trabajo de parto y el per√≠odo postnatal inmediato. Estos se registraran utilizando arquetipos de observaci√≥n - por ejemplo, la informaci√≥n relacionada con la historia y examen durante las visitas prenatales o controles durante el parto.

No debe utilizarse para registrar la informaci√≥n de resumen sobre la historia obst√©trica de la mujer - utilizar EVALUATION.obstetric_summary.

No debe utilizarse para registrar la informaci√≥n detallada sobre el ciclo menstrual de una mujer - OBSERVATION.menstrual_cycle uso.

No debe utilizarse para registrar informaci√≥n detallada acerca de la alimentaci√≥n infantil - se utiliza un arquetipo diferente.

No debe utilizarse para registrar un resumen general de la historia menstrual o un diario - se utilizar√°n arquetipos distintos.

ru.purpose: *To provide a framework and design guidance for consistent modelling of content within a template for a Medication list. (en)
ru.use:
*Use as a framework and suggested design guidance for consistent modelling of content within a template for an Medication list.

This archetype is intended to be used within the COMPOSITION.medication_list or as one component of other COMPOSITION archetypes. For example: complex documents, such as a discharge summary or referral.

This list can be comprised of three types of statements, each represented by specific archetypes:
- statements about the positive use of medications can be recorded using multiple instances of the INSTRUCTION.medication_order; OR
- statements about the positive exclusion of use of medications can be recorded using the specific EVALUATION.exclusion-global  - for example: 'No known adverse reactions'; OR
- statements about no information being available - neither a positive use of medications nor a positive exclusion - can be recorded using the EVALUATION.absence archetype..

Statements about the absence of medication orders, either general or specific, can only indicate the state of the subject at the time that the information was actually recorded - that is, they are event based. It is not sensible to persist the recording of a positive absence of a medication order as it may subsequently be ordered or self-administered by the patient, which may render any or all previous positive statements of absence obsolete. 

INSTRUCTION.medication is suggested as the best archetype to represent a Medication list in this instance as it generally provides the best representation of a local Current Medication List. Clinicians can enter patient-administered medications or 'over the counter' medications into a Prescribing system as INSTRUCTIONs, which in turn can enable adverse reaction checking against all INSTRUCTIONS, whether prescribed/printed or not. So Current Medication lists can effectively contain all orders for medications, given by both the recording clinician, other clinicians and the patient. An alternative form of the  Medication list comprising only ACTIONs can be used represent only those medication that have been prescribed/printed by the recording clinician. (en)

- statements about the positive use of medications can be recorded using multiple instances of the INSTRUCTION.medication_order; OR
- statements about the positive exclusion of use of medications can be recorded using the specific EVALUATION.exclusion-global  - for example: 'No known adverse reactions'; OR
- statements about no information being available - neither a positive use of medications nor a positive exclusion - can be recorded using the EVALUATION.absence archetype..

Statements about the absence of medication orders, either general or specific, can only indicate the state of the subject at the time that the information was actually recorded - that is, they are event based. It is not sensible to persist the recording of a positive absence of a medication order as it may subsequently be ordered or self-administered by the patient, which may render any or all previous positive statements of absence obsolete. 

INSTRUCTION.medication is suggested as the best archetype to represent a Medication list in this instance as it generally provides the best representation of a local Current Medication List. Clinicians can enter patient-administered medications or 'over the counter' medications into a Prescribing system as INSTRUCTIONs, which in turn can enable adverse reaction checking against all INSTRUCTIONS, whether prescribed/printed or not. So Current Medication lists can effectively contain all orders for medications, given by both the recording clinician, other clinicians and the patient. An alternative form of the  Medication list comprising only ACTIONs can be used represent only those medication that have been prescribed/printed by the recording clinician. (en)

de.purpose: Zur Darstellung von Angaben √ºber alle Aktivit√§ten, die im Zusammenhang mit der Planung, Vorbereitung, Rezeptbearbeitung, Ausgabe, Verabreichung, Absetzung und sonstigen Verwendung von Medikamenten, Impfungen, Nahrungserg√§nzungsmitteln oder anderen therapeutischen Mitteln stehen.
de.use:
Zur Darstellung von Informationen √ºber Aktivit√§ten der Arzneimittelanwendung, einschlie√ülich der Planung, Vorbereitung, Aussetzung, Absetzung und Beendigung von Arzneimittelverordnungen, sowie der aktuellen Verabreichung von Arzneimitteln. Die Erfassung der Daten bestimmter Aktivit√§ten erfolgt durch die im "Pathway/Pfad" des Archetyps definierten Arbeitsschritte. 

Dieser Archetyp ist f√ºr alle Arten von Arzneimitteln und die damit verbundene Verordnung bestimmt, unabh√§ngig davon, ob sie von einem Arzt verschrieben werden oder ob sie "rezeptfrei" gekauft werden. Der Anwendungsbereich dieses Arzneimittel-Archetyps umfasst auch die Anwendung von Impfungen, parenteralen L√∂sungen oder anderen therapeutischen Produkten, wie Verb√§nden, Nahrungserg√§nzungs- oder anderen Mitteln, die zum Erzeugen einer therapeutischen Wirkung angewandt oder verabreicht werden und ein gemeinsames Muster f√ºr die Datenerfassung haben. Im Zusammenhang mit einer Medikamenten- oder Impfliste wird dieser Archetyp zur Darstellung von verschriebenen oder verabreichten Arzneimitteln oder Impfungen verwendet. 

Zus√§tzliche strukturierte und detaillierte Informationen √ºber die Arzneimittel-Aktivit√§t k√∂nnen √ºber zweckgebundene Archetypen erfasst werden. Sie k√∂nnen in die SLOTs "Arzneimitteldetails", "Dosis", "Lokalisation", "Verabreichungsmittel" oder "Zus√§tzliche Details" eingef√ºgt werden. 

Zeitliche Abl√§ufe im Zusammenhang mit der Arzneimittelanwendung k√∂nnten auf zwei Arten gehandhabt werden:
- unter Verwendung des Referenzmodells - die Zeit der Ausf√ºhrung eines beliebigen Prozessschrittes wird √ºber die Verwendung des ACTION-Time-Attributs aufgezeichnet.
- mit dem Archetyp-Datenelement - das Datenelement "Urspr√ºnglich geplantes Datum/Uhrzeit" soll die Zeit erfassen, zu der das Arzneimittel zur Verabreichung bestimmt war. Hinweis: Das entsprechende Attribut "ACTION-Time" f√ºr den geplanten Prozessschritt erfasst die Zeit, zu der die klinische Aktivit√§t in einem System terminiert wurde, nicht jedoch das beabsichtigte Datum/Uhrzeit, zu dem die Aktivit√§t ausgef√ºhrt werden sollte.

In der Praxis werden einige Arzneimittel (z.B. bei Reanimation in der Notaufnahme) auf der Grundlage eines Protokolls oder einer m√ºndlichen Anordnung verabreicht und nicht im Voraus verordnet. Die Details zu dem Arzneimittel werden zusammen mit dem Prozessschritt "Dosis wurde verabreicht" hinzugef√ºgt. F√ºr eine andauernde Arzneimittelbehandlung werden die Daten zum Arzneimittel zusammen mit dem Prozessschritt "Dosis wurde verabreicht" bei jeder Verabreichung erfasst. Die Verordnung bleibt dabei beim Status "Aktiv". Wenn das letzte Ereignis vermerkt wird, wird der Prozessschritt "Arzneimittelbehandlung ist abgeschlossen" erfasst. Die Verordnung des Arzneimittels erh√§lt nun den Status "abgeschlossen".

In anderen Situationen, wie z.B. in der Sekund√§rversorgung, kann es eine formale Verordnung f√ºr ein Arzneimittel mit einem entsprechenden Archetyp INSTRUCTION.medication_order geben. Dieser ACTION-Archetyp wird dann zur Darstellung des Workflows, also wann und wie die Verordnung ausgef√ºhrt wurde, verwendet. 

Die Darstellung von Informationen mit diesem ACTION-Archetyp zeigt an, dass eine bestimmte Aktivit√§t tats√§chlich stattgefunden hat; dies ist in den meisten F√§llen die Verabreichung eines Arzneimittels, kann aber auch ein verz√∂gerter Bereitstellungsversuch oder eine andere Aktivit√§t sein, wie z.B. das Aussetzen einer Medikamentengabe zur Vorbereitung auf eine Operation. Gibt es eine offizielle Verordnung des Arzneimittels, wird der Status dieser Verordnung durch den Prozessschritt repr√§sentiert, in welchem die Daten registriert werden. Mit diesem Archetyp kann beispielsweise der weitere Verlauf einer Paracetamol-Verordnung in den EHR Prozessschritten dargestellt werden. Das Datenelement "Begr√ºndung" wird dabei verwendet, um den Grund zu dokumentieren, warum dieser Prozessschritt, z.B. das Weglassen einer Dosis oder das Einstellen einer Arzneimittelgabe, vorgenommen wurde. 

Wird dieser ACTION-Archetyp mit dem entsprechenden Archetyp INSTRUCTION.medication_order verwendet, werden die Informationen, die sich nicht von der Verordnung- zur Anwendungsaktivit√§t ge√§ndert haben, in der Aktion im Allgemeinen nicht wiederholt. Es wird als gute Praxis angesehen, obwohl dies nicht obligatorisch ist, das Arzneimittel in der AKTION aufzuzeichnen.

Die Prozessschritte unterscheiden sich zwischen denen, die sich direkt auf die Erf√ºllung der Verordnung beziehen, wie Autorisierung, Zubereitung und Verabreichung der Dosis, und denen, die sich auf die Handhabung des Rezeptes beziehen, wie Ausstellung, erneute Autorisierung und Abgabe. In einigen L√§ndern wird das als ein Prozessschritt angesehen. In anderen wird es als hilfreich erachtet, die Erf√ºllung der Verordnung und die Handhabung des Rezeptes in separaten Templates darzustellen.

Die meisten Namen der Prozessschritte dieses Archetyps enthalten die Namen "Arzneimittel" oder "Rezept" bzw. "Verordnung". Dies soll die Unterscheidung der einzelnen Prozessschritte erleichtern. 

In einigen L√§ndern kann ein Rezept erneut genehmigt werden, um eine laufende Medikamentenverordnung fortzusetzen, w√§hrend in anderen L√§ndern unter diesen Umst√§nden ein v√∂llig neues Rezept ausgestellt werden muss. In letzterem Fall ist der Prozessschritt "Rezept ist re-autorisiert" nicht anwendbar.
de.misuse:
Nicht zur Repr√§sentation eines Arzneimittelrezeptes oder Verordnung verwenden. F√ºr diesen Zweck muss der Archetyp INSTRUCTION.medication_order eingesetzt werden.

Nicht zur Repr√§sentation der Verabreichung oder Abgabe von Blutprodukten verwenden. Sie haben meist einen vollkommen anderen klinischen Ablauf und erfordern meist andere unterst√ºtzende Informationen. Ein anderer geeigneter ACTION-Archetyp muss f√ºr diesen Zweck verwendet werden.

Nicht zur Darstellung von Details √ºber die Compliance/Therapietreue, Nebenwirkungen oder Toxizit√§t verwenden. F√ºr diesen Zweck muss ein anderer Archetyp verwendet werden.

Nicht f√ºr den Medikamentenabgleich verwenden. F√ºr diesen Zweck muss der passende Archetyp verwendet werden. 

Nicht f√ºr eine formelle √úberpr√ºfung einer ganzen Medikamentenliste, z.B. durch einen Apotheker, verwenden. F√ºr diesen Zweck m√ºssen andere geeignete Archetypen verwendet werden.

sv.purpose: F√∂r registrering av detaljer om aktiviteter som √§r relaterade till planering, schemal√§ggning, recepthantering, utdelning, administrering, upph√∂rande och annan anv√§ndning av l√§kemedel, vaccin, n√§ringsprodukt eller annan behandlings produkt.
sv.use:
Anv√§nds f√∂r att registrera information om de aktiviteter som kr√§vs f√∂r att st√∂dja alla aspekter av l√§kemedelshantering inklusive planering, schemal√§ggning, avbrott, avbokning, slutf√∂rande av l√§kemedelsbest√§llningar och den faktiska administreringen av l√§kemedelsf√∂rem√•l. Detta g√∂rs genom att registrera data f√∂r specifika aktiviteter, som definieras av "Pathway" -fl√∂desstegen i denna arketyp.

Arketypen √§r avsedd f√∂r att anv√§ndas f√∂r alla typer av medicineringar och relaterade best√§llningar, oavsett om det ordinerats av en v√•rdpersonal eller √§r receptfri. I skopet inkluderar ocks√• best√§llningar p√• vaccinationer, parenterala v√§tskor eller andra behandlings produkter, s√•som bandage, n√§ringsprodukter eller andra f√∂rem√•l som appliceras eller administreras f√∂r att ha en behandlingseffekts. N√•got gemensamt mellan de √§r att alla har samma dataregistrerings pattern/m√∂nster. Denna arketyp kommer att anv√§ndas f√∂r bara registrering av medicinering eller vaccination som har ordinerats eller administrerats i en l√§kemedels- eller vaccinationslista.

Ytterligare strukturerad och detaljerad information om aktiviteten kan f√•ngas med hj√§lp av m√•lbaserade och specifika arketyper infogade i '' Preparations details '', '' Amount'', 'Structured body site', 'Administration device' eller 'Additional details' SLOTs.

Tider relaterade till l√§kemedelshantering kan hanteras p√• ett av tv√• s√§tten:
- Anv√§nda Referensmodellen -f√∂r att registrera tiden f√∂r att utf√∂ra alla steg, anv√§nd attributet ACTION time 
- Archetyped data element - dataelementet "Original schemalagt datum / tid" √§r avsett att registrera den tid d√• l√§kemedelsartikeln var avsedd att administreras. Notera! Motsvarande ACTION-tidsattribut f√∂r den schemalagda steget registrerar den tid d√• den kliniska aktiviteten planerades i ett system, det beskriver inte det best√§mda datumet / tiden n√§r aktiviteten √§r avsedd att utf√∂ras.

I praktiken kommer vissa l√§kemedel (till exempel vid √•terupplivning p√• akutmottagningen) att administreras baserad p√• protokoll eller en muntlig ordination. Det kommer inte att best√§llas i f√∂rv√§g. L√§kemedlets detaljer kommer att l√§ggas till i steget: "Dos administrerad". F√∂r en p√•g√•ende medicinering kommer data om l√§kemedelsartikeln att registreras i steget "Dos administrerad", man beh√∂ver l√§mna instruktionen i aktivt tillst√•nd tills medicineringen √§r klar. N√§r den sista h√§ndelsen registreras och information om sista steget "L√§kemedelsprocess slutf√∂rd" √§r klarregistrerad d√• visas "status klar" f√∂r ordinationen.

I andra situationer, till exempel sekund√§rv√•rd, kan det finnas en formell best√§llning av ett l√§kemedels artikel med en motsvarande INSTRUKTION.medicin_order-arketyp. Denna ACTION-arketyp kan sedan anv√§ndas f√∂r att registrera arbetsfl√∂det f√∂r tid, datum och hur ordinationen har genomf√∂rts. 

Det kan vara s√• att leverant√∂ren har inte hunnit med leverans av l√§kemedlet i tid eller annan aktivitet orsakat s√• att f√∂rberedelse av l√§kemedels artikel har avbrutits. Om det finns en formell best√§llning f√∂r l√§kemedelsartikeln, administreras detta i sj√§lva processen f√∂r f√∂rberedelse av medicinska artikel, 
Om det finns en formell best√§llning f√∂r en l√§kemedelsartikel kommer statusbeskrivning av denna artikel presenteras i steget d√§r data √§r registrerad. 

Exempelvis, Med hj√§lp av denna arketyp kan det fortskridande tillst√•ndet f√∂r en Paracetamol best√§llning registreras. detta g√∂rs genom att det separata poster i EHR-framstegsnoterna vid varje "Pathway" -steg. N√§r man dokumenterar anledningen till varf√∂r en aktivitet utf√∂rdes eller ett v√§gsteg valdes.
Elementet "orsak" anv√§nds f√∂r att registrera anledningen till varf√∂r en aktivitet upph√∂rdes eller ett v√§gsteg valdes, till exempel varf√∂r en dos utel√§mnades eller en nedicineringen upph√∂rde.

Anv√§ndning av ACTION-arketyp samt INSTRUCTION.medication_order-arketyp g√∂r s√• att of√∂r√§ndrade information fr√•n ordningen till hanteringsaktiviteten i ACTION inte upprepas. Det anses vara bra praxis, men inte obligatoriskt, att registrera l√§kemedelsartikeln i HANDLINGEN.

V√§gstegen skapar skillnader mellan de som direkt relatera sig till uppfyllandet av best√§llningen, s√•som auktorisering, beredning och dosadministration, och de som avser hantering av receptet s√•som utf√§rdande, om identifiering och utdelning. I vissa jurisdiktioner betraktas dessa som en enda v√§g, i andra kan det vara till hj√§lp att hantera best√§llning och recept i separata mallar.

Namnen p√• de flesta v√§gstegen i den h√§r arketypen b√∂rjar med antingen "Medicinering" eller "Recept". Detta f√∂r att g√∂ra det l√§ttare att skilja mellan de v√§gsteg som √§r relaterade till recepthantering och de som √§r associerade med hanteringen av sj√§lva l√§kemedelsbest√§llningen.

I vissa jurisdiktioner kan ett recept godk√§nnas p√• nytt, detta f√∂r att kunna forts√§tta med en p√•g√•ende l√§kemedelsbest√§llning, medan i andra m√•ste ett helt nytt recept utf√§rdas under dessa omst√§ndigheter. I det sistn√§mnda g√§ller inte v√§gsteget "Receptbel√§ggning p√• nytt".
sv.misuse:
F√•r inte anv√§ndas f√∂r att registrera en l√§kemedelsordination eller instruktion. Anv√§nd arketypen INSTRUCTION.medication_order f√∂r detta √§ndam√•l.

Anv√§nds inte arketypen f√∂r att registrera administrering eller dosering av blodprodukter, vilket inneb√§r en helt annan klinisk process och sannolikt kommer att kr√§va annan st√∂djande information. Anv√§nd en annan l√§mplig ACTION-arketyp f√∂r detta √§ndam√•l.

F√•r inte anv√§ndas f√∂r registrering av detaljer om efterlevnadsbehandling, sekund√§ra effekter eller toxicitet. Anv√§nd andra arketyper f√∂r dessa √§ndam√•l.

F√•r inte anv√§ndas f√∂r avst√§mning av l√§kemedel. Anv√§nd andra l√§mpliga arketyper f√∂r detta √§ndam√•l.

F√•r inte anv√§ndas f√∂r en formell granskning av en hel l√§kemedelslista, till exempel av en apotekare. Anv√§nd andra l√§mpliga arketyper f√∂r detta √§ndam√•l.

ru.use:
*For recording the planning, issuing of a prescription, dispensing, administration, cessation, suspension, completion of a medicine, vaccine or other therapeutic good . This will usually be in response to a medication order but may be administered immediately without an order at times, thus requiring recording of the administration alone (e.g. in an emergency situation). 

Such a record may be made to indicate the administration of a dose, dispensing of a certain quantity or as a record of ceasing a medication. The state of the medication instruction is altered by the action taken as indicated in the Pathway definition.

There is a date and time at which this ACTION took place (as there is for all ACTIONs)  and use of this archetype indicates that some action has actually occurred.(en)
ru.misuse: *Do not use when recording an instruction or order (use INSTRUCTION.medication).(en)

es-ar.purpose: Este ACTION permite la grabaci√≥n de las ordenes de prescripciones. Esto ser√° normalmente en respuesta a una orden de medicaci√≥n o prescripci√≥n, pero puede ser autoadministrado o suministrada por una farmacia. No existe informacion sobre si el uso de este arquetipo implica que alguna accion haya efectivamente sido ejecutada
es-ar.use:
*For recording the planning, issuing of a prescription, dispensing, administration, cessation, suspension, completion of a medicine, vaccine or other therapeutic good . This will usually be in response to a medication order but may be administered immediately without an order at times, thus requiring recording of the administration alone (e.g. in an emergency situation). 

Such a record may be made to indicate the administration of a dose, dispensing of a certain quantity or as a record of ceasing a medication. The state of the medication instruction is altered by the action taken as indicated in the Pathway definition.

There is a date and time at which this ACTION took place (as there is for all ACTIONs)  and use of this archetype indicates that some action has actually occurred.(en)
es-ar.misuse: *Do not use when recording an instruction or order (use INSTRUCTION.medication).(en)

nb.purpose: For √• registrere detaljer om enhver legemiddelrelatert oppgave som utf√∏res fra et legemiddel er ordinert eller rekvirert til det er utdelt eller eventuelt kassert, for eksempel bestilling, istandgj√∏ring, administrering, ekspedering eller seponering.
nb.use:
Brukes til √• registrere detaljer om enhver legemiddelrelatert oppgave som utf√∏res fra et legemiddel er ordinert eller rekvirert til det er utdelt eller eventuelt kassert, for eksempel bestilling, istandgj√∏ring, administrering eller ekspedering. Dette gj√∏res ved √• registrere data i sammenheng med spesifikke aktiviteter, som definert av "Pathway" prosesstrinnene i arketypen.

Denne arketypen er ment for √• brukes til en hvilken som helst type legemiddel og tilh√∏rende ordinering, enten den er ordinert av en kliniker eller tilgjengelig uten resept. Den er ment √• ogs√• dekke vaksiner, parenterale v√¶sker, ern√¶ringsprodukter eller medisinsk forbruksmateriell. Innenfor en legemiddelliste eller vaksinasjonsliste brukes denne arketypen for √• registrere hva som er ordinert eller administrert.

Ytterligere strukturerte detaljer om aktiviteten kan ved behov registreres ved hjelp av spesifikke arketyper som settes inn i SLOTene "Legemiddeldetaljer", "Legemiddelmengde", "Strukturert anatomisk lokalisering", "Administreringsutstyr" eller "Ytterligere detaljer".

Timing i forbindelse med legemiddelh√•ndtering kan gj√∏res p√• to forskjellige m√•ter:
- Ved √• bruke referansemodellen: Tidspunktet for utf√∏relsen av en aktivitet bruker "ACTION time"-attributten for hvert prosesstrinn, for eksempel n√•r en dose ble administrert eller n√•r legemiddelet ble seponert.
- Ved hjelp av informasjonselementer i arketyper: Elementet "Opprinnelig planlagt tid" er ment for √• registrere tidspunktet da legemiddelet if√∏lge ordineringen skulle v√¶rt administrert. Merk: Den korresponderende "ACTION time"-attributten for prosesstrinn av typen "scheduled" vil registrere tidspunktet da planleggings-steget ble lagt inn i systemet, ikke tidspunktet n√•r aktiviteten er planlagt √• bli utf√∏rt.

I praksis vil noen legemidler, for eksempel under gjenoppliving, administreres p√• bakgrunn av en prosedyre eller verbal ordinering, og ikke bli registrert p√• forh√•nd. Detaljer om legemiddelet vil i disse tilfellene bli registrert i sammenheng med prosesstrinnet "Legemiddel administrert". N√•r det skal gj√∏res flere administreringer, blir informasjon om legemiddelet bli registrert i sammenheng med prosesstrinnet "Legemiddel administrert" for hver administrering, og instruksjonen beholder statusen "active". N√•r siste administrering er utf√∏rt, settes prosesstrinnet "Medisinering fullf√∏rt".

I andre situasjoner, som for eksempel vanlig ordinering i sykehus, kan det eksistere en formell ordinering for hvert legemiddel i form av en "INSTRUCTION.medication_order"-arketype. Denne ACTION-arketypen kan da brukes for √• registrere arbeidsflyten for n√•r og hvordan ordineringen ble utf√∏rt.

√Ö registrere informasjon ved hjelp av denne ACTION-arketypen indikerer at en aktivitet faktisk har blitt utf√∏rt. Dette vil vanligvis v√¶re administrering av legemiddelet, me kan ogs√• v√¶re forsinket levering fra apotek eller andre aktiviteter som √• nulle ut legemiddelet i forkant av en operasjon. Dersom det finnes en formell ordinering av legemiddelet, representeres status for ordineringen ved prosesstrinnet informasjonen er registrert i sammenheng med. For eksempel kan arketypen brukes for √• registrere den p√•g√•ende statusen for en paracetamol-ordinering gjennom en serie registreringer i journalen som hver har sitt prosesstrinn. Man kan bruke elementet "√Örsak" dersom man trenger √• registrere begrunnelsen for at en aktivitet ble utf√∏rt eller et prosesstrinn ble valgt, for eksempel hvorfor en enkeltdose ble nullet eller legemiddelet ble seponert.

N√•r denne ACTION-arketypen brukes sammen med den korresponderende INSTRUCTION.medication_order-arketypen, vil man generelt ikke gjenta informasjon som ikke er endret fra ordineringen. Det regnes som god praksis, men ikke obligatorisk, √• registrere legemiddelnavnet ogs√• i ACTION-arketypen.

Navnene p√• prosesstrinnene skiller mellom dem som har direkte sammenheng med utf√∏relse av ordineringen, som autorisering, istandgj√∏ring eller administrering, og dem som har med resepth√•ndtering √• gj√∏re, som utstedelse eller ekspedering. I noen myndighetsomr√•der er dette regnet som √©n prosess, mens det i andre kan v√¶re nyttig √• h√•ndtere dem separat.

I noen myndighetsomr√•der kan en resept reautoriseres for √• fortsette en p√•g√•ende ordinering, mens det i andre m√• utstedes en helt ny resept. For sistnevnte omr√•der er ikke prosesstrinnene "Reautorisering av resept satt p√• vent" eller "Resept reautorisert" relevante.
nb.misuse:
Skal ikke brukes for √• registrere ordinering av legemidler. Bruk arketypen INSTRUCTION.medication_order for dette form√•let.

Skal ikke brukes for √• registrere administrering eller utlevering av blodkomponenter, da dette er en grunnleggende annerledes prosess som krever annen informasjon. Bruk en annen, passende ACTION-arketype til dette form√•let.

Skal ikke brukes for √• registrere detaljer om adheranse, sekund√¶reffekter eller toksisitet. Bruk andre arketyper for disse form√•lene.

Skal ikke brukes for legemiddelsamstemming. Bruk andre arketyper for dette form√•let.

Skal ikke brukes for en formell gjennomgang av en hel legemiddelliste, for eksempel av farmas√∏yt. Bruk andre arketyper for dette form√•let.

pt-br.misuse:

ar-sy.use:
*For recording the planning, issuing of a prescription, dispensing, administration, cessation, suspension, completion of a medicine, vaccine or other therapeutic good . This will usually be in response to a medication order but may be administered immediately without an order at times, thus requiring recording of the administration alone (e.g. in an emergency situation). 

Such a record may be made to indicate the administration of a dose, dispensing of a certain quantity or as a record of ceasing a medication. The state of the medication instruction is altered by the action taken as indicated in the Pathway definition.

There is a date and time at which this ACTION took place (as there is for all ACTIONs)  and use of this archetype indicates that some action has actually occurred.(en)
ar-sy.misuse: *Do not use when recording an instruction or order (use INSTRUCTION.medication).(en)

sl.purpose: *The recording of activities undertaken with regard to a medicine, vaccine or other therapeutic good and linking to the instruction if appropriate.
sl.use:
*For recording the planning, issuing of a prescription, dispensing, administration, cessation, suspension, completion of a medicine, vaccine or other therapeutic good . This will usually be in response to a medication order but may be administered immediately without an order at times, thus requiring recording of the administration alone (e.g. in an emergency situation). 

Such a record may be made to indicate the administration of a dose, dispensing of a certain quantity or as a record of ceasing a medication. The state of the medication instruction is altered by the action taken as indicated in the Pathway definition.

There is a date and time at which this ACTION took place (as there is for all ACTIONs)  and use of this archetype indicates that some action has actually occurred.
sl.misuse: *Do not use when recording an instruction or order (use INSTRUCTION.medication).

en.purpose: For recording details about any activity related to the planning, scheduling, prescription management, dispensing, administration, cessation and other use of a medication, vaccine, nutritional product or other therapeutic item.
en.use:
Use to record information about the activities required to support all aspects of medication management, including the planning, scheduling, suspension, cancellation and completion of medication orders, as well as the actual administration of medication items. This is done by the recording of data against specific activities, as defined by the 'Pathway' careflow steps in this archetype.

This archetype is intended to be used for any type of medication and related order, whether prescribed by a health professional or available for purchase 'over the counter'. The scope of this medication archetype also includes orders for vaccinations, parenteral fluids or other therapeutic goods, such as bandages, nutritional products or other items that are applied or administered to have a therapeutic effect and which have a common pattern for data recording. Within the context of a Medication or Vaccination List, this archetype will be used to record only what medication or vaccination has been prescribed or administered.

Additional structured and detailed information about the activity can be captured using purpose-specific archetypes inserted into the 'Preparations details', 'Amount', 'Structured body site', 'Administration device' or 'Additional details' SLOTs, where required.

Timings related to medication management can be managed in one of two ways:
- Using the reference model - the time for performance of any pathway step will use the ACTION time attribute for each step.
- Archetyped data elements - the 'Original scheduled date/time' data element is intended to record the time when the medication item was intended to be administered. Note: the corresponding ACTION time attribute for the Scheduled pathway step will record the time that the clinical activity was scheduled into a system, not the intended date/time on which the activity is intended to be carried out.

In practice, some medications (for example, during resuscitation in the emergency department) will be administered on the basis of a protocol or verbal order and not be ordered in advance. The details about the medication will be added against the pathway step 'Dose administered'. For an ongoing course of medication, data about the medication item will be recorded against the 'Dose administered' step at each administration, leaving the instruction in the active state. When the last occurrence is recorded the ‚ÄòMedication course completed' step is recorded showing that this order is now in the completed state.

In other situations, such as secondary care, there may be a formal order for a medication item using a corresponding INSTRUCTION.medication_order archetype. This ACTION archetype can then be used to record the workflow of when and how the order has been carried out.

Recording information using this ACTION archetype indicates that some sort of activity has actually occurred; this will most commonly be the administration of the medication item itself, but may be a delayed supply attempt or another activity such as suspending the medication item in preparation for a procedure. If there is a formal order for the medication item, the state of this order is represented by the Pathway step against which the data is recorded. For example, using this archetype the progressing state of a Paracetamol order may be recorded through separate entries in the EHR progress notes at each 'Pathway' step. When documenting the reason for why an activity was performed or a pathway step was chosen, for example why a dose was omitted or the medication was ceased, the element "Reason" may be used. 

When this ACTION archetype is used with the corresponding INSTRUCTION.medication_order archetype, information which hasn't changed from the order to the management activity aren't generally repeated in the action. It's considered good practice, though not mandatory, to record the medication item in the ACTION.

The pathway steps make a distinction between those which relate directly to fulfillment of the order, such as authorisation, preparation and dose administration, and those which relate to handling of the prescription such as issue, re-authorisation, dispensing. In some jurisdictions these are regarded as a single pathway, in others it may be helpful to handle order fulfillment and prescription in separate templates.

The names of most of the pathway steps in this archetype start with either "Medication" or "Prescription" to make it easier to differentiate between the pathway steps that are associated with prescription handling and those that are associated with handling the medication order itself.

In some jurisdictions, a prescription can be re-authorised for the purpose of continuing an ongoing medication order, while in others an entirely new prescription must be issued in these circumstances. In the latter, the pathway step 'Prescription re-authorised' is not applicable.
en.misuse:
Not to be used for recording a medication order or instruction. Use the INSTRUCTION.medication_order archetype for this purpose.

Not to be used to record the administration or dispensing of blood products, which involves a fundamentally different clinical process and is likely to require different supporting information. Use a different appropriate ACTION archetype for this purpose.

Not to be used for recording details about therapeutic adherence, secondary effects or toxicity. Use other archetypes for these purposes.

Not to be used for medication reconcilliation. Use other appropriate archetypes for this purpose.

Not to be used for a formal review of an entire medication list, for example by a pharmacist. Use other appropriate archetypes for this purpose.

Êú¨ÂéüÂßãÂûãÊó®Âú®Áî®‰∫é‰ªª‰ΩïÁ±ªÂûãÁöÑËçØÁâ©ÂåªÂò±ÂíåÁõ∏ÂÖ≥ÂåªÂò±ÔºåÊó†ËÆ∫ÊòØÂÅ•Â∫∑‰∏ì‰∏ö‰∫∫ÂëòÁöÑÂ§ÑÊñπÊâÄÂºÄÂÖ∑ÁöÑËçØÁâ©ËøòÊòØÂèØÂú®‚ÄúËçØÊàøÊüúÂè∞‚ÄùË¥≠‰π∞ÁöÑÈùûÂ§ÑÊñπËçØ„ÄÇËøô‰∏ÄËçØÁâ©ÂéüÂßãÂûãÁöÑËåÉÂõ¥ËøòÂåÖÊã¨ÂÖ≥‰∫éÁñ´ËãóÊé•Áßç„ÄÅÊ≥®Â∞ÑÊ∂≤ÊàñÂÖ∂‰ªñÊ≤ªÁñóÁ±ªÂà∂ÂâÇ/‰∫ßÂìÅÁöÑÂåªÂò±„ÄÇ‰æãÂ¶ÇÔºåÁª∑Â∏¶„ÄÅËê•ÂÖª‰∫ßÂìÅ/Âà∂ÂìÅÊàñÂÖ∂‰ªñÂ∫îÁî®ÊàñÊñΩÁî®Ëµ∑Êù•ÂÖ∑ÊúâÊ≤ªÁñóÊïàÊûúÁöÑ‰∫ßÂìÅ/Âà∂ÂìÅ/Âà∂ÂâÇÔºõËÄå‰∏îÔºåÊ≠§Á±ªÁöÑ‰∫ßÂìÅ/Âà∂ÂìÅ/Âà∂ÂâÇÂú®Êï∞ÊçÆËÆ∞ÂΩïÊñπÈù¢ÊúâÁùÄÂÖ±ÂêåÁöÑÊ®°Âºè„ÄÇÂú®ËçØÁâ©ÊàñÁñ´ËãóÊé•ÁßçÊ∏ÖÂçïÁöÑËÉåÊôØ‰∏ãÔºåÊú¨ÂéüÂßãÂûãÂ∞Ü‰ªÖ‰ªÖÁî®‰∫éËÆ∞ÂΩïÂ§ÑÊñπÂ∑≤ÂºÄÂÖ∑ÊàñÂ∑≤ÊñΩÁî®ÁöÑËçØÁâ©ÊàñÁñ´Ëãó[Êé•Áßç]„ÄÇ

Â¶ÇÊûúÈúÄË¶ÅÔºåÂèØ‰ª•Âà©Áî®ÊèíÂÖ•Âà∞‚ÄúÂà∂ÂâÇËØ¶ÊÉÖ‚ÄùÔºàPreparations detailsÔºâ„ÄÅ‚ÄúÊï∞Èáè‚ÄùÔºàAmountÔºâ„ÄÅ‚ÄúÁªìÊûÑÂåñË∫´‰ΩìÈÉ®‰Ωç‚ÄùÔºàStructured body siteÔºâ„ÄÅ‚ÄúÊñΩÁî®/ÁªôËçØËÆæÂ§á‚ÄùÔºàAdministration deviceÔºâÊàñ‚ÄúÂÖ∂‰ªñËØ¶ÊÉÖ‚ÄùÔºàAdditional detailsÔºâÊßΩ‰ΩçÔºàSLOTÔºâ‰πã‰∏≠ÈíàÂØπÂÖ∑‰ΩìÁõÆÁöÑÁöÑÂéüÂßãÂûãÔºåÊù•ÈááÈõÜÂÖ≥‰∫éÁõ∏Â∫îÊ¥ªÂä®ÁöÑÂÖ∂‰ªñÁªìÊûÑÂåñËØ¶ÊÉÖ„ÄÇ

ÂèØ‰ª•ÈááÁî®‰∏ãÂàó‰∏§ÁßçÊñπÂºè‰πã‰∏ÄÊù•ÁÆ°ÁêÜ‰∏éËçØÁâ©ÁÆ°ÁêÜÁõ∏ÂÖ≥ÁöÑÊó∂Èó¥ÁâπÂæÅÔºàÊó∂Êú∫ÂÆâÊéíÔºâ‰ø°ÊÅØÔºö
- Âà©Áî®ÂèÇËÄÉÊ®°Âûã - ‰ªª‰ΩïË∑ØÂæÑÊ≠•È™§ÁöÑÊâßË°åÊó∂Èó¥Â∞ÜÈááÁî®ÁöÑÊòØÊØè‰∏™Ê≠•È™§ÁöÑË°åÂä®ÔºàACTIONÔºâÊó∂Èó¥Â±ûÊÄß„ÄÇ
- ÂéüÂßãÂûãÊï∞ÊçÆÂÖÉ - ‚ÄúÂéüÂßãÈ¢ÑÂÆöÊó•Êúü/Êó∂Èó¥‚ÄùÔºàOriginal scheduled date/timeÔºâÊï∞ÊçÆÂÖÉÊó®Âú®ËÆ∞ÂΩïÈ¢ÑÂÆö/ÊâìÁÆóÊñΩÁî®Áõ∏Â∫îËçØÁâ©ÁöÑÊó∂Èó¥„ÄÇÊ≥®ÊÑèÔºöÂ∑≤ÊéíÁ®ã/ÂÆâÊéíËÆ°ÂàíÔºàScheduledÔºâË∑ØÂæÑÊ≠•È™§ÁöÑÁõ∏Â∫îË°åÂä®ÔºàACTIONÔºâÊó∂Èó¥Â±ûÊÄßÂ∞ÜËÆ∞ÂΩïÁöÑÊòØÂ∞ÜÁõ∏Â∫îÁöÑ‰∏¥Â∫äÊ¥ªÂä®ÊéíÁ®ã/ÂÆâÊéíÂà∞Á≥ªÁªüÂΩì‰∏≠ÁöÑÊó∂Èó¥ÔºåËÄå‰∏çÊòØÈ¢ÑÂÆö/ÊâìÁÆóÂºÄÂ±ïÁõ∏Â∫îÊ¥ªÂä®ÁöÑÈ¢ÑÂÆöÊó•Êúü/Êó∂Èó¥„ÄÇ

Âú®ÂÆûÈôÖÂ∑•‰Ωú‰∏≠Ôºå‰∏Ä‰∫õËçØÁâ©ÔºàÂ¶ÇÊÄ•ËØäÁßëÂ§çËãèÊúüÈó¥ÁöÑÁî®ËçØÔºâÂ∞ÜÊ†πÊçÆÁâπÂÆöÁöÑËØäÁñóÊñπÊ°àÊàñÂè£Â§¥ÂåªÂò±Êù•ËøõË°åÊñΩÁî®/ÁªôËçØÔºåËÄå‰∏çÊòØÊèêÂâçÂºÄÁ´ãÂåªÂò±„ÄÇÂ∞Ü‰ºöÈíàÂØπË∑ØÂæÑÊ≠•È™§‚ÄúÊñΩÁî®/ÁªôËçØÂâÇÈáè‚ÄùÔºàDose administeredÔºâÔºåÊù•Ê∑ªÂä†ÂÖ≥‰∫éËçØÁâ©ÁöÑËØ¶ÊÉÖ„ÄÇÂØπ‰∫éÊ≠£Âú®ËøõË°å‰πã‰∏≠ÁöÑËçØÁâ©Ê≤ªÁñóËøáÁ®ãÔºåÂ∞Ü‰ºöÈíàÂØπÊØèÊ¨°ÊñΩÁî®/ÁªôËçØÊó∂ÁöÑÊ≠•È™§‚ÄúÊñΩÁî®/ÁªôËçØÂâÇÈáè‚ÄùÔºàDose administeredÔºâÔºåÊù•ËÆ∞ÂΩïÂÖ≥‰∫éÁõ∏Â∫îÂÖ∑‰ΩìËçØÁâ©ÁöÑÊï∞ÊçÆÔºåÂπ∂‰ΩøÁõ∏Â∫îÁöÑÂåªÂò±Êåá‰ª§‰øùÊåÅÊúâÊïàÁä∂ÊÄÅ„ÄÇÂΩìËÆ∞ÂΩïÊúÄÂêé‰∏ÄÊ¨°ÊñΩÁî®/ÁªôËçØÁöÑÊÉÖÂÜµÊó∂ÔºåÂ∞ÜËÆ∞ÂΩïÁöÑÊ≠•È™§ÊòØ‚ÄúÂ∑≤ÂÆåÊàêÁöÑËçØÁâ©Ê≤ªÁñóËøáÁ®ã‚ÄùÔºàMedication course completedÔºâÔºåË°®ÊòéËØ•ÂåªÂò±Áé∞Âú®Â§Ñ‰∫éÂ∑≤ÂÆåÊàêÁöÑÁä∂ÊÄÅ„ÄÇ

Âú®ÂÖ∂‰ªñÁöÑÊÉÖÂÜµ‰∏ãÔºåÂ¶Ç‰∫åÁ∫ßÁÖßÊä§ÊúçÂä°/ÂåªÁñóÊä§ÁêÜÊúçÂä°ÔºåÂàôÂèØËÉΩÂ≠òÂú®ÈíàÂØπÁõ∏Â∫îÂÖ∑‰ΩìËçØÁâ©ÁöÑÊ≠£ÂºèÂåªÂò±ÔºåËÄåÊ≠§Á±ªÁöÑÂåªÂò±ÈááÁî®ÁöÑÊòØÁõ∏Â∫îÁöÑËçØÁâ©ÂåªÂò±ÂéüÂßãÂûã INSTRUCTION.medication_order„ÄÇËøôÊ†∑ÔºåÂ∞±ÂèØ‰ª•Âà©Áî®ÂΩìÂâçÁöÑË°åÂä®ÔºàACTIONÔºâÂéüÂßãÂûãÊù•ËÆ∞ÂΩïÂÖ≥‰∫é‰ΩïÊó∂‰ª•ÂèäÂ¶Ç‰ΩïÊâßË°åËØ•ÂåªÂò±ÁöÑÂ∑•‰ΩúÊµÅ„ÄÇ

ÈááÁî®ÂΩìÂâçËøô‰∏ÄË°åÂä®ÔºàACTIONÔºâÂéüÂßãÂûãÊù•ËÆ∞ÂΩï‰ø°ÊÅØË°®ÊòéÔºåÂÆûÈôÖ‰∏äÂ∑≤ÁªèÂèëÁîü‰∫ÜÊüêÁßçÊ¥ªÂä®ÔºõÊ≠§Á±ªÊ¥ªÂä®ÊúÄ‰∏∫Â∏∏ËßÅÁöÑÂ∞±ÊòØÁõ∏Â∫îÂÖ∑‰ΩìËçØÁâ©Êú¨Ë∫´ÁöÑÊñΩÁî®/ÁªôËçØÔºå‰ΩÜ‰πüÂèØËÉΩÊòØÂª∂Ëøü‰æõÂ∫îÁöÑÂ∞ùËØïÔºåÊàñËÄÖÊòØÂÖ∂‰ªñÊ¥ªÂä®ÔºåÂ¶Ç‰∏∫ÂáÜÂ§áÊüêÈ°πÊìç‰ΩúËÄåÊöÇÂÅúÁõ∏Â∫îÁöÑÂÖ∑‰ΩìËçØÁâ©„ÄÇÂ¶ÇÊûúÁõ∏Â∫îÂÖ∑‰ΩìÁöÑËçØÁâ©ÊúâÊ≠£ÂºèÁöÑÂåªÂò±ÔºåÂàôÈááÁî®ÊçÆ‰ª•ËÆ∞ÂΩïÁõ∏Â∫îÊï∞ÊçÆÁöÑË∑ØÂæÑÊ≠•È™§Êù•Ë°®ËææËØ•ÂåªÂò±ÁöÑÁä∂ÊÄÅ„ÄÇ‰æãÂ¶ÇÔºåÂèØ‰ª•ÈááÁî®Ëøô‰∏ÄÂéüÂßãÂûãÔºåÂà©Áî®ÊØè‰∏™‚ÄúË∑ØÂæÑ‚ÄùÊ≠•È™§Êó∂EHRÁóÖÁ®ãËÆ∞ÂΩï‰πã‰∏≠ÁöÑ‰∏çÂêåÊù°ÁõÆÔºåÊù•ËÆ∞ÂΩïÂØπ‰πôÈÖ∞Ê∞®Âü∫ÈÖöÔºàÊâëÁÉ≠ÊÅØÁóõÔºâÂåªÂò±ÁöÑËøõÂ±ïÁä∂ÊÄÅ„ÄÇ
Âú®ËÆ∞ÂΩïÂÖ≥‰∫éÂºÄÂ±ïÁâπÂÆöÊ¥ªÂä®ÊàñÈÄâÊã©ÁâπÂÆöË∑ØÂæÑÊ≠•È™§ÁöÑÂéüÂõ†Êó∂ÔºåÂ¶Ç‰∏∫‰ΩïÁúÅÁï•ÁâπÂÆöÂâÇÈáèÁöÑËçØÁâ©ÊàñÂÅúÁî®Áõ∏Â∫îÁöÑËçØÁâ©ÔºåÂàôÂèØ‰ª•‰ΩøÁî®Êï∞ÊçÆÂÖÉ‚ÄúÂéüÂõ†‚ÄùÔºàReasonÔºâ„ÄÇ

ÂΩìËøô‰∏ÄË°åÂä®ÔºàACTIONÔºâÂéüÂßãÂûã‰∏éÁõ∏Â∫îÁöÑËçØÁâ©ÂåªÂò±ÂéüÂßãÂûãINSTRUCTION.medication_order ‰∏ÄËµ∑‰ΩøÁî®Êó∂Ôºå‰∏ÄËà¨Âπ∂‰∏ç‰ºöÂú®Áõ∏Â∫îÁöÑÂä®‰Ωú‰πã‰∏≠ÈáçÂ§ç‰ªéÂåªÂò±Âà∞ÁÆ°ÁêÜÊ¥ªÂä®Âπ∂Êú™ÂèëÁîüÂèòÂåñÁöÑ‰ø°ÊÅØ„ÄÇÂú®Ë°åÂä®ÔºàACTIONÔºâ‰∏≠ËÆ∞ÂΩïÁõ∏Â∫îÁöÑÂÖ∑‰ΩìËçØÁâ©Â±û‰∫éÊòØ‰∏ÄÁßçÂæàÂ•ΩÁöÑÂÅöÊ≥ïÔºåËôΩÁÑ∂Âπ∂ÈùûÂº∫Âà∂ÊÄßÁöÑË¶ÅÊ±Ç„ÄÇ

Ë∑ØÂæÑÊ≠•È™§ÂèØ‰ª•Âå∫ÂàÜÈÇ£‰∫õË∑üÂåªÂò±ÊâßË°åÁõ¥Êé•Áõ∏ÂÖ≥ÁöÑÊ≠•È™§ÔºåÂ¶ÇÊéàÊùÉ„ÄÅÂáÜÂ§áÂíåÂâÇÈáèÊñΩÁî®Ôºå‰∏éÈÇ£‰∫õË∑üÂ§ÑÊñπÂ§ÑÁêÜÁõ∏ÂÖ≥ÁöÑÊ≠•È™§ÔºåÂ¶ÇÁ≠æÂèë„ÄÅÈáçÊñ∞ÊéàÊùÉ„ÄÅÈÖçÂèë„ÄÇÂú®Êüê‰∫õÂè∏Ê≥ïÁÆ°ËæñÂå∫ÂüüÔºå‰ºöÂ∞ÜËøô‰∫õÊ≠•È™§ËßÜ‰∏∫Âêå‰∏ÄË∑ØÂæÑ[ÁöÑÂÜÖÂÆπ]ÔºåËÄåÂú®ÂÖ∂‰ªñÁöÑÂè∏Ê≥ïÁÆ°ËæñÂå∫ÂüüÔºåÂèØËÉΩ‰ºöÊúâÊâÄÂ∏ÆÂä©ÁöÑÂÅöÊ≥ïÂàôÊòØÈááÁî®‰∏çÂêåÁöÑÊ®°ÊùøÊù•Â§ÑÁêÜÂåªÂò±Â±•Ë°åÂíåÂ§ÑÊñπ„ÄÇ

Êú¨ÂéüÂßãÂûã‰πã‰∏≠Â§ßÂ§öÊï∞Ë∑ØÂæÑÊ≠•È™§ÁöÑÂêçÁß∞Âùá‰ª•‚ÄúËçØÁâ©‚ÄùÊàñ‚ÄúÂ§ÑÊñπ‚ÄùÂºÄÂ§¥Ôºå‰ª•‰æøÊõ¥Êòì‰∫éÂå∫ÂàÜÈÇ£‰∫õË∑üÂ§ÑÊñπÂ§ÑÁêÜÁõ∏ÂÖ≥ÁöÑË∑ØÂæÑÊ≠•È™§‰∏éÈÇ£‰∫õË∑üÂ§ÑÁêÜËçØÁâ©ÂåªÂò±Êú¨Ë∫´Áõ∏ÂÖ≥ÁöÑË∑ØÂæÑÊ≠•È™§„Äê‰∏≠ÊñáÂêçÁß∞ÁöÑÊÉÖÂÜµÂèØËÉΩÂπ∂ÈùûÂ¶ÇÊ≠§„Äë„ÄÇ

Âú®Êüê‰∫õÂè∏Ê≥ïÁÆ°ËæñÂå∫ÂüüÔºåË¶ÅÁªßÁª≠Ê≤øÁî®ÊåÅÁª≠‰ΩøÁî®ÁöÑËçØÁâ©ÂåªÂò±ÔºåÂèØ‰ª•ÈáçÊñ∞ÊéàÊùÉÁõ∏Â∫îÁöÑÂ§ÑÊñπÔºåËÄåÂú®ÂÖ∂‰ªñÁöÑÂè∏Ê≥ïÁÆ°ËæñÂå∫ÂüüÔºåÂú®Ê≠§Á±ªÁöÑÊÉÖÂÜµ‰∏ãÔºåÂàôÂøÖÈ°ªÁ≠æÂèëÂÖ®Êñ∞ÁöÑÂ§ÑÊñπ„ÄÇÂú®Âêé‰∏ÄÁßçÊÉÖÂÜµ‰∏ãÔºåË∑ØÂæÑÊ≠•È™§‚ÄúÂ∑≤ÈáçÊñ∞ÊéàÊùÉÁöÑÂ§ÑÊñπ‚ÄùÔºàPrescription re-authorisedÔºâÂ∞Ü‰∏çÈÄÇÁî®„ÄÇ

at0000.description: *Any activity related to the planning, scheduling, prescription management, dispensing, administration, cessation and other use of a medication, vaccine, nutritional product or other therapeutic item.(en)
at0000.comment: *This is not limited to activities performed based on medication orders from clinicians, but could also include for example taking over the counter medication.(en)

at0002.description: *A prescription has been issued for the medication.(en)

at0003.description: *The ordered medication has been dispensed, for example from a pharmacy to the patient.(en)

at0004.description: *The medication has been taken by, or administered to, the patient for the first time. Although in some settings this significant date may be computable as the first of several administrations, in other settings, such as primary care, specific administration dates are not readily available.(en)

at0005.description: *The specific medication item has been reviewed, as planned. This is not intended to capture review of the whole medication list.(en)

at0006.description: *A single administration of the medication has taken place.(en)

at0007.description: *The medication course has been completed as planned.(en)

at0008.description: *The prescription has not been dispensed due to a technical or pharamaceutical supply issue.(en)

at0009.description: *The administration of the medication has been suspended until further notice. No further doses should be given until the restart date or conditions have been met. When setting the date/conditions for restart after suspending, a step from ‚ÄòAdministrations suspended‚Äô and back to 'Medication start date/condition set' should be performed.(en)

at0010.description: *A prescription token has been re-issued for an existing medication order.(en)

at0011.description: *Reissuing of this prescription is not available without some intervention.(en)

at0012.description: *The planned course of medication has been cancelled prior to any administration.(en)

at0013.description: *The scheduled medication course has been postponed prior to any administration.(en)

at0015.description: *The administration of this medication has been ceased after the first dose has been administered, but before intended completion of the course.  (en)

at0016.description: *The time to start this medication, or other starting condition, has been set.(en)

at0018.description: *The administration of a medication has been withheld and not given. There is no expectation that it will be given later, though the next dose (if any) should be administered according to the original order.(en)

at0020.description: *Name of the medication, vaccine or other therapeutic/prescribable item which was the focus of the activity.(en)
at0020.comment:
*For example: 'Atenolol 100mg' or 'Tenormin tablets 100mg'. 
It is strongly recommended that the 'Medication item' is coded with a terminology capable of triggering decision support, where possible. The extent of coding may vary from the simple name of the medication item through to structured details about the actual medication pack used. Free text entry should only be used if there is no appropriate terminology available.(en)

at0021.description: *Reason that the pathway step for the identified medication was carried out.(en)
at0021.comment: *For example: 'Postponed - Patient not avalable at administration time', 'Cancelled - Adverse reaction'. Note: This is not the reason for the medication instruction, but rather the specific reason that a care step was carried out, and will often be used to document some variance from the original order.(en)

at0024.description: *Additional narrative about the activity or care pathway step not captured in other fields, including details of any variance between the intended action and the action actually performed.(en)
at0024.comment: *For example: 'Patient was in radiology department', 'Accidental injection into blood vessel during IM administration'.(en)

at0025.description: *The sequence number specific to the activity being recorded.(en)

at0033.description: *Any guidance, instructions or advice given to the subject of care or personal carer at the time of the pathway step.(en)
at0033.comment: *For example: 'Avoid grapefruit' , 'Take at least 2 hours before bedtime', 'Take with food'. May be coded with a terminology when clinically appropriate.(en)

at0039.description: *A major change to the order was required, resulting in this order being stopped and a replacement order being started.(en)

at0041.description: *The medication order has been changed in a manner which does not require a new instruction/order to be issued, according to local clinical rules.(en)

at0043.description: *The datetime at which the medication action was scheduled to occur.(en)
at0043.comment: *Used to compare variance from actual action time where this is not readily calculable from the original instruction.(en)

at0044.description: *Administration of a dose of mediciation has been delayed but is expected to be given as soon as possible.(en)

at0053.description: *Further structured details of the action, possibly specific to a pathway step.(en)

at0103.comment: *Comment: This data element allows for multiple occurrences to be defined more explicitly at run-time, if required.(en)

at0104.description: *Structured details about the medication including strength, form and constituent substances.(en)
at0104.comment: *Use this SLOT where the detailed description of the dispensed, authorised or administered item needs to be explicitly stated. For example: the form, strength, any diluents or mixture of ingredients.(en)

at0106.description: *The original medication order has been re-authorised to allow repeat prescription or dispensing. In some jurisdictions an entirely new order must be issued in these circumstances.(en)

at0109.description: *The medication has been recommended but no steps have been taken to initiate prescribing.(en)

at0131.description: *Specific details about the amount of the medication item.(en)
at0131.comment: *Dosage_administration is intended to carry details of medication order changes or dose administrations, whilst medication_supply_amount is intended for details of dispensing-related activity.(en)

at0132.description: *Subsitution action taken by the person administering or dispensing the drug.(en)
at0132.comment: *In many jurisdictions, substitution of an ordered item as a generic form or with a different brand name, which has been determined as bioequivalent, is allowed at the point of dispense or supply. In other cases substitution is assumed and the clinician has to explicitly request non-substitution.(en)

at0133.description: *The reason or justification for the substitution action taken.(en)
at0133.comment: *For example: "Generic alternative contains a substance that is not tolerated by the patient." May be coded with a terminology when clinically appropriate(en)

at0138.description: *A medication was substituted which is bioequivalent to that ordered.(en)

at0139.description: *Although allowed by the medication order a bioequvalent medication was not substituted.(en)

at0140.description: *Details of body site and administration of the medication.(en)

at0147.description: *The route by which the ordered item was, or is to be, administered into the subject's body.(en)

at0156.description: *The clinical reason for the medication activity. (en)
at0156.comment: *For example: 'Angina' or 'Pain'. Coding of the indication with a terminology is preferred, where possible. This data element allows multiple occurrences. Note: This is not the reason for the medication instruction, but rather the specific reason that a care step was carried out, and will often be used to document some variance from the original order.(en)

at0024.description: *Additional narrative about the activity or care pathway step not captured in other fields, including details of any variance between the intended action and the action actually performed.(en)
at0024.comment: *For example: 'Patient was in radiology department', 'Accidental injection into blood vessel during IM administration'.(en)

at0025.description: *The sequence number specific to the activity being recorded.(en)

at0033.description: *Any guidance, instructions or advice given to the subject of care or personal carer at the time of the pathway step.(en)
at0033.comment: *For example: 'Avoid grapefruit' , 'Take at least 2 hours before bedtime', 'Take with food'. May be coded with a terminology when clinically appropriate.(en)

at0039.description: *A major change to the order was required, resulting in this order being stopped and a replacement order being started.(en)

at0041.description: *The medication order has been changed in a manner which does not require a new instruction/order to be issued, according to local clinical rules.(en)

at0043.description: *The datetime at which the medication action was scheduled to occur.(en)
at0043.comment: *Used to compare variance from actual action time where this is not readily calculable from the original instruction.(en)

at0044.description: *Administration of a dose of mediciation has been delayed but is expected to be given as soon as possible.(en)

at0053.description: *Further structured details of the action, possibly specific to a pathway step.(en)

at0103.comment: *Comment: This data element allows for multiple occurrences to be defined more explicitly at run-time, if required.(en)

at0104.description: *Structured details about the medication including strength, form and constituent substances.(en)
at0104.comment: *Use this SLOT where the detailed description of the dispensed, authorised or administered item needs to be explicitly stated. For example: the form, strength, any diluents or mixture of ingredients.(en)

at0106.description: *The original medication order has been re-authorised to allow repeat prescription or dispensing. In some jurisdictions an entirely new order must be issued in these circumstances.(en)

at0109.description: *The medication has been recommended but no steps have been taken to initiate prescribing.(en)

at0131.description: *Specific details about the amount of the medication item.(en)
at0131.comment: *Dosage_administration is intended to carry details of medication order changes or dose administrations, whilst medication_supply_amount is intended for details of dispensing-related activity.(en)

at0132.description: *Subsitution action taken by the person administering or dispensing the drug.(en)
at0132.comment: *In many jurisdictions, substitution of an ordered item as a generic form or with a different brand name, which has been determined as bioequivalent, is allowed at the point of dispense or supply. In other cases substitution is assumed and the clinician has to explicitly request non-substitution.(en)

at0133.description: *The reason or justification for the substitution action taken.(en)
at0133.comment: *For example: "Generic alternative contains a substance that is not tolerated by the patient." May be coded with a terminology when clinically appropriate(en)

at0138.description: *A medication was substituted which is bioequivalent to that ordered.(en)

at0139.description: *Although allowed by the medication order a bioequvalent medication was not substituted.(en)

at0140.description: *Details of body site and administration of the medication.(en)

at0141.description: *Structured description of the site of administration of the ordered item.(en)
at0141.comment:
*For example: 'left upper arm', 'intravenous catheter right hand'. 
Coding of the body site with a terminology is preferred, where possible.(en)

at0142.description: *Structured description of the site of administration of the medication, vaccine or therapeutic good.(en)
at0142.comment: *For example: "On the medial skin surface of the left forearm, from 10 cm to 20 cm distally from the point of the elbow".(en)

at0143.description: *The technique or device by which the ordered item was, or is to be, administered.(en)
at0143.comment: *Comment: For example: ' via Z-track injection'; 'via nebuliser'. Coding of the method with a terminology is preferred, where possible.(en)

at0144.description: *Details of the medical device used to assist administration of the medication.(en)

at0145.description: *Draft prescription has been prepared and is awaiting confirmation from an authorised clinician. May be used where reauthorisations are performed as a batch. This careflow_step may have a status of 'planned' or 'active', reflecting the need to to handle new orders as well as re-authorised orders.(en)

at0147.description: *The route by which the ordered item was, or is to be, administered into the subject's body.(en)
at0147.comment: *Comment: For example: 'oral', 'intravenous', or 'topical'. Coding of the route with a terminology is preferred, where possible. Multiple potential routes may be specified.(en)

at0148.description: *The medication has been physically prepared. For example: preparation of an intravenous mixture.(en)

at0149.description: *The action step has been checked by a separate individual.(en)
at0149.comment: *Details of the individual performing the double-check can be carried in the Reference Model element "Participation".(en)

at0150.description: *The prescription was cancelled prior to being issued.(en)

at0151.description: *Prescription has been invalidated or has expired without being fulfilled.(en)

at0153.description: *The medication has been formally authorised for use.(en)

at0154.description: *The date/time on which the medication course is set to restart, as per the "Medication restart date/condition set" pathway step.(en)

at0155.description: *The criterion which triggers the medication course to restart, as per the "Medication restart date/condition set" pathway step.(en)

at0156.description: *The clinical reason for the medication activity. (en)
at0156.comment: *For example: 'Angina' or 'Pain'. Coding of the indication with a terminology is preferred, where possible. This data element allows multiple occurrences. If only an ACTION is used to record a medication indication, this data element can be used without additional consideration. However, if a clinical indication is recorded for both the Medication order INSTRUCTION and this Medication management ACTION, be aware that these indications might not be consistent." (en)

at0000.description: Any activity related to the planning, scheduling, prescription management, dispensing, administration, cessation and other use of a medication, vaccine, nutritional product or other therapeutic item.
at0000.comment: This is not limited to activities performed based on medication orders from clinicians, but could also include for example taking over the counter medication.

at0002.description: A prescription has been issued for the medication.

at0003.description: The ordered medication has been dispensed, for example from a pharmacy to the patient.

at0004.description: The medication has been taken by, or administered to, the patient for the first time. Although in some settings this significant date may be computable as the first of several administrations, in other settings, such as primary care, specific administration dates are not readily available.

at0005.description: The individual medication has been reassessed, for example whether the medication should still be taken. This is not intended to capture review of the medication list.

at0006.description: A single administration of the medication has taken place.

at0007.description: The medication course has been completed as planned.

at0008.description: The prescription has not been dispensed due to a technical or pharamaceutical supply issue.

at0009.description: The administration of the medication has been suspended until further notice. No further doses should be given until the restart date or conditions have been met. When setting the date/conditions for restart after suspending, a step from ‚ÄòAdministrations suspended‚Äô and back to 'Medication start date/condition set' should be performed.

at0010.description: A prescription has been re-issued for an existing medication order.

at0011.description: Issue of the prescription is awaiting re-authorisation by a clinician.

at0012.description: The planned course of medication has been cancelled prior to any administration.

at0013.description: The scheduled medication course has been postponed prior to any administration.

at0015.description: Administration of the medication has been ceased during the period of the intended course.

at0016.description: The time to start the medication, or other starting condition, has been set.

at0018.description: An administration of the medication has been withheld and not given. There is no expectation that it will be given later, though the next dose (if any) should be administered according to the original order.

at0020.description: Name of the medication, vaccine or other therapeutic/prescribable item which was the focus of the activity.
at0020.comment:
For example: 'Atenolol 100mg' or 'Tenormin tablets 100mg'. 
It is strongly recommended that the 'Medication item' is coded with a terminology capable of triggering decision support, where possible. The extent of coding may vary from the simple name of the medication item through to structured details about the actual medication pack used. Free text entry should only be used if there is no appropriate terminology available.

at0021.description: Reason that the pathway step for the identified medication was carried out.
at0021.comment: For example: 'Postponed - Patient not avalable at administration time', 'Cancelled - Adverse reaction'. Note: This is not the reason for the medication instruction, but rather the specific reason that a care step was carried out, and will often be used to document some variance from the original order.

at0024.description: Additional narrative about the activity or pathway step not captured in other fields, including details of any variance between the intended action and the action actually performed.
at0024.comment: For example: 'Patient was in radiology department', 'Accidental injection into blood vessel during IM administration'.

at0025.description: The sequence number specific to the pathway step being recorded.

at0033.description: Any guidance, instructions or advice given to the subject of care or personal carer at the time of the pathway step.
at0033.comment: For example: 'Avoid grapefruit' , 'Take at least 2 hours before bedtime', 'Take with food'. May be coded with a terminology when clinically appropriate.

at0039.description: A major change to the order was required, resulting in this order being stopped and a replacement order being started.

at0041.description: The medication order has been changed in a manner which does not require a new instruction/order to be issued, according to local clinical rules.

at0043.description: The datetime at which the medication action was scheduled to occur.
at0043.comment: Used to compare variance from actual action time where this is not readily calculable from the original instruction.

at0044.description: An administration of a dose of the medication has been delayed but is expected to be given as soon as possible.

at0053.description: Further structured details of the action, possibly specific to a pathway step.

at0085.description: Additional information required to capture local content or to align with other reference models/formalisms.
at0085.comment: For example: local information requirements or additional metadata to align with FHIR or CIMI equivalents.

at0103.description: Unique identifier for the medication order.
at0103.comment: Comment: This data element allows for multiple occurrences to be defined more explicitly at run-time, if required.

at0104.description: Structured details about the medication including strength, form and constituent substances.
at0104.comment: Use this SLOT where the detailed description of the dispensed, authorised or administered item needs to be explicitly stated. For example: the form, strength, any diluents or mixture of ingredients.

at0106.description: The original medication order has been re-authorised to allow repeat prescription or dispensing. In some jurisdictions an entirely new order must be issued in these circumstances.

at0109.description: The medication has been recommended but no steps have been taken to initiate prescribing.

at0131.description: Specific details about the amount of the medication item.
at0131.comment: CLUSTER.dosage is intended to carry details of medication order changes or dose administrations, whilst CLUSTER.medication_supply_amount is intended for details of dispensing-related activity.

at0132.description: Subsitution action taken by the person administering or dispensing the drug.
at0132.comment: In many jurisdictions, substitution of an ordered item as a generic form or with a different brand name, which has been determined as bioequivalent, is allowed at the point of dispense or supply. In other cases substitution is assumed and the clinician has to explicitly request non-substitution.

at0133.description: The reason or justification for the substitution action taken.
at0133.comment: For example: "Generic alternative contains a substance that is not tolerated by the patient." May be coded with a terminology when clinically appropriate

at0138.description: A medication was substituted which is bioequivalent to that ordered.

at0139.description: Although allowed by the medication order a bioequvalent medication was not substituted.

at0140.description: Details of body site and administration of the medication.

at0141.description: Structured description of the site of administration of the ordered item.
at0141.comment:
For example: 'left upper arm', 'intravenous catheter right hand'.

at0144.description: Details of the medical device used to assist administration of the medication.

at0156.description: The clinical reason for the medication activity.
at0156.comment: For example: 'Angina' or 'Pain'. Coding of the indication with a terminology is preferred, where possible. This data element allows multiple occurrences. de.purpose: Zur Schaffung von Rahmenbedingungen f√ºr die Darstellung von Antworten auf vordefinierte Screening-Fragen zu Beschwerden, Problemen oder Diagnosen.
keywords: Erkrankung, Zustand, Krankheit, Syndrom, Fragebogen, Befragung, Screening, Problem
de.use:
Verwendung als Rahmenbedingung f√ºr die Darstellung von Antworten auf vordefinierte Screening-Fragen zu Beschwerden, Problemen oder Diagnosen.

H√§ufige Anwendungsf√§lle umfassen, sind aber nicht beschr√§nkt auf:
Systematische Befragung in jedem Beratungsgespr√§ch, zum Beispiel:
--- Wurde eine Krebserkrankung diagnostiziert? Ja, Nein, Unbekannt.
--- Wurde COVID 19 oder Influenza in den vergangenen zw√∂lf Monaten diagnostiziert? Ja, Nein, Unbekannt.
--- Haben Sie irgendwelche Sorgen oder Problemen? Ja, Nein, Unbekannt.
- Spezifische Befragungen in Bezug auf Krankheits√ºberwachung.

Die Semantiken dieses Archetyps sind mit Absicht vage und diesen Archetyp abzufragen w√ºrde √ºblicherweise nur sinnvoll und sicher im Kontext vom einzelnen spezifischen Template sein. In einem Template w√ºrde jedes Daten Element in eine der spezifisch gestellten Fragen umbenannt werden. Wenn Gruppen an Werten f√ºr √ºbliche Anwendungsf√§lle bereits vorgeschlagen wurden, k√∂nnen diese f√ºr den lokalen Gebrauch mit Hilfe der "Text"- Auswahl an den jeweiligen spezifischen Anwendungsfall angepasst werden.

√úber die EVENT-Struktur aus dem Referenzmodell kann festgelegt werden, ob sich die Fragen auf einen Zeitpunkt oder einen Zeitraum beziehen. Verwenden Sie eine separate Instanz dieses Archetyps, um zwischen einer Befragung zu unterscheiden, der Informationen √ºber eine Diagnose enth√§lt, die zu einem beliebigen Zeitpunkt in der Vergangenheit aufgetreten war, und Informationen √ºber eine Diagnose, die innerhalb eines bestimmten Zeitintervalls auftrat - zum Beispiel den Unterschied zwischen "Hatten Sie Influenza?" und "Hatten Sie in den vergangenen 4 Wochen Influenza?".

Die Quelle der Informationen in einer Fragebogenantwort kann in verschiedenen Kontexten variieren, kann jedoch mithilfe des Elements ‚ÄûInformation provider‚Äú im Referenzmodell spezifisch identifiziert werden.

Dieser Archetyp wurde entwickelt, um als Screening-Tool oder zur Darstellung einfacher Daten im Fragebogenformat zur Verwendung in Situationen wie einem Krankheitsregister verwendet zu werden. Wenn der Screening-Fragebogen das Vorhandensein eines Problems oder einer Diagnose identifiziert, wird empfohlen, dass das klinische System die spezifischen Details √ºber das Problem oder die Diagnose (wie z. B. das Datum der klinischen Feststellung) unter Verwendung des Archetyps EVALUATION.problem_diagnosis darstellt und beibeh√§lt.
de.misuse:
Darf nicht verwendet werden, um Details zum Vorhanden oder Nicht-Vorhanden eines Problems oder einer Diagnose au√üerhalb eines Screening-Kontexts darzustellen. Daf√ºr EVALUATION.problem_diagnosis oder EVALUATION.exclusion_specific benutzen.

Darf nicht verwendet werden, um ein Framework f√ºr die Darstellung von Antworten auf vordefinierte Screening-Fragen zu Prozeduren, die in der Vergangenheit durchgef√ºhrt wurden, zu erstellen. Daf√ºr OBSERVATION.procedure_screening benutzen.

Darf nicht verwendet werden, um ein Framework f√ºr die Darstellung von Antworten auf vordefinierte Screening-Fragen zu Nebenwirkungen (Adverse Reactions) zu erstellen. Daf√ºr einen angemessenen Archetyp benutzen.

Darf nicht verwendet werden, um Details zu einer einfachen Auswahlliste darzustellen, in der eine Frage entweder als "vorhanden" oder "unbestimmt" aufgezeichnet werden kann. Verwenden Sie dazu OBSERVATION.selection_list.

nb.purpose: For √• lage et rammeverk for registrering av svar p√• forh√•ndsdefinerte sp√∏rsm√•l om bekymringer, plager, problemer eller diagnoser.
keywords: tilstand, sykdom, syndrom, sp√∏rreskjema, kartlegging, bekymring, plage
nb.use:
Brukes for √• lage et rammeverk for registrering av svar p√• forh√•ndsdefinerte sp√∏rsm√•l om bekymringer, plager, problemer eller diagnoser.
Arketypen er l√∏st modellert for √• inkludere det bredeste spekteret av bekymringer, plager og problemer, samt diagnoser.

Vanlige bruksomr√•der inkluderer, men er ikke begrenset til:
- Systematiske sp√∏rsm√•l ved konsultasjoner, for eksempel:
--- Diagnostisert med kreft? Ja, Nei, Ukjent.
--- Diagnostisert med Covid 19 eller influensa de siste tolv m√•nedene? Ja, Nei, Ukjent.
- Spesifikke sp√∏rsm√•l relatert til overv√•kning av sykdommer.

Semantikken til denne arketypen er med vilje l√∏st definert, og sp√∏rringer etter data i denne arketypen vil normalt bare v√¶re hensiktsmessig eller sikkert i konteksten av det spesifikke templatet. I et templat vil hvert dataelement vanligvis d√∏pes om til det (spesifikke) sp√∏rsm√•let man √∏nsker svar p√•. Flere steder er det foresl√•tt verdisett som passer til de vanligste bruksomr√•der, men det er allikevel mulig √• tilpasse/endre verdisett for lokal bruk ved √• benytte de alternative datatypene DV_TEXT eller DV_BOOLEAN for √• harmonere verdisettet til hvert enkelt brukstilfelle.

EVENT-strukturen fra arketypens referansemodell kan brukes for √• spesifisere om sp√∏rsm√•lene relateres til et tidspunkt eller til et tidsintervall.
Bruk egne instanser av denne arketypen for √• skille mellom sp√∏rsm√•l om prosedyrer som er gjennomf√∏rte p√• et hvilket som helst tidspunkt og sp√∏rsm√•l om prosedyrer som er gjennomf√∏rt i et tidsintervall. For eksempel; "Har du influensa?" sammenlignet med "Har du hatt influensa de siste 4 ukene?".

Kilden til informasjonen i et sp√∏rreskjema kan variere i ulike kontekster, men kan identifiseres spesifikt ved √• benytte "Information provider" elementet i openEHR referansemodellen.

Denne arketypen er laget for √• bli brukt i et sp√∏rreskjema eller for √• registrere enkle strukturerte data til for eksempel et sykdomsregister. Dersom det i kartleggingen identifiseres at et problem eller en diagnose er tilstede, anbefales det at spesifikke detaljer om problemet eller diagnosen (som for eksempel diagnosedato) registreres og lagres i pasientjournalen i arketypen EVALUATION.problem_diagnosis (Problem/diagnose).
nb.misuse:
Brukes ikke for √• registrere detaljer om tilstedev√¶relse eller frav√¶r av et problem eller en diagnose utenfor konteksten av kartleggingen. Bruk arketypen EVALUATION.problem_diagnosis eller EVALUATION.exclusion_specific for dette form√•let.

Brukes ikke for √• lage et rammeverk for registrering av svar p√• forh√•ndsdefinerte sp√∏rsm√•l om gjennomf√∏rte prosedyrer, bruk arketypen OBSERVATION.procedure_screening for dette form√•let.

Brukes ikke for √• lage et rammeverk for registrering av svar p√• forh√•ndsdefinerte sp√∏rsm√•l om overf√∏lsomhetsreaksjoner, bruk arketypen OBSERVATION.adverse_reaction_screening for dette form√•let.

Brukes ikke for √• registrere detaljer om en enkel utvalgsliste der et sp√∏rsm√•l kan registreres som enten "Tilstede" eller "Ubestemt". Bruk arketypen OBSERVATION.selection_list for dette form√•let.

en.purpose: To create a framework for recording answers to pre-defined screening questions about issues, problems or diagnoses.
keywords: Condition, state, illness, syndrome, questionnaire, screening, issue
en.use:
Use to create a framework for recording answers to pre-defined screening questions about issues, problems or diagnoses. 
This archeype has deliberately been loosely modelled to be inclusive of the broadest range of issues and problems, as well as diagnoses.

Common use cases include, but are not limited to:
- Systematic questioning in any consultation, for example:
--- Diagnosed with cancer? Yes, No, Unknown.
--- Diagnosed with COVID 19 or Influenza in the past twelve months? Yes, No, Unknown.
--- Do you have any worries or concerns? Yes, No, Unknown.
- Specific questioning related to disease surveillance.

The semantics of this archetype are intentionally loose, and querying this archetype would normally only be useful or safe within the context of each specific template. In a template, each data element would usually be renamed to the specific question asked. Where value sets have been proposed for common use cases, these can be adapted for local use by using the DV_TEXT or the DV_BOOLEAN datatypes choice to match each specific use case.

The EVENT structure from the reference model can be used to specify whether the questions relate to point in time or over a period of time. Use a separate instance of this archetype to distinguish between a questionnaire recording information about a procedure that has been performed at any time in the past and information about a procedure performed within a specified time interval - for example the difference between "Do you have influenza?" compared to "Have you had influenza in the past 4 weeks?"

The source of the information in a questionnaire response may vary in different contexts but can be specifically identified using the 'Information provider' element in the Reference Model.

This archetype has been designed to be used as a screening tool or to record simple questionnaire-format data for use in situations such as a disease registry. If the screening questionnaire identifies the presence of a problem or diagnosis, it is recommended that clinical system record and persist the specific details about the problem or diagnosis (such as the date of clinical recognition) using the EVALUATION.problem_diagnosis archetype.
en.misuse:
Not to be used to record details about the presence or absence of a problem or diagnosis, outside of a screening context. Use EVALUATION.problem_diagnosis or EVALUATION.exclusion_specific for these purposes.

Not to be used to to create a framework for recording answers to pre-defined screening questions about procedures that has been carried out in the past. Use the OBSERVATION.procedure_screening for this purpose.

Not to be used to to create a framework for recording answers to pre-defined screening questions about adverse reactions, use an appropriate archetype for this purpose.

Not to be used to record details about a simple selection list where a question may be recorded as either "present" or "indeterminate". Use OBSERVATION.selection_list for this purpose.

en.purpose: To record a subset of persistent or summary information about the pregnancy and birth of an infant, that may be used within both the mother's and infant's health record.
en.use:
Use to record a subset of persistent or summary information about the pregnancy and birth of an infant, usually recorded as part of a maternal health record or birth report, but also able to be shared and reused to provide context about the pregnancy and birth within the newborn's health record.

This archetype has been designed to be nested:
- in the 'Birth detail' SLOT within the EVALUATION.pregnancy_summary archetype, to capture details about an infant born to the mother; and
- in the 'Birth detail' SLOT within the EVALUATION.birth_summary archetype, to capture or reuse details about the birth of the individual.

at0014.description: Vaginal delivery assisted by the use of high forceps with rotation.

at0015.description: Surgical delivery by a transverse approach in the lower uterine segment (LUSCS).

at0016.description: Surgical delivery by an approach in the upper uterine segment.

at0003.comment: For example: singleton or first of a multiple birth; second; third etc.

at0004.comment: The value for this data element will usually, but not always, be identical to the 'Pregnancy duration' data element within the EVALUATION.pregnancy_summary in the maternal record. It may also be derived using the 'Agreed date' data element within the EVALUATION.estimated_date_delivery archetype in the maternal record. Usually estimated by Naegele's rule or by ultrasound scan.

at0005.comment: For example: vaginal; forceps rotation; or Caesarean Section.
